Summary Global strategy and thought leadership professional with success in leading, building, and driving teams for high performance. Successful track record to help large/medium enterprises and professional services organizations develop business strategies, market analysis, and corporate transformation. Trusted advisor in helping organizations develop appropriate strategies to make informed business decisions.

Summary Service at Evangel University for over 20 years in areas of student life, career development, counseling, academic support, and teaching. Passionate about helping students gain a sense of vocational calling in their lives; actively engages in opportunities for practical integration of faith, living, and learning. Experienced in conducting campus studies incorporating strengths-based research on vocational advising, academic motivation, and vocational calling. Empirical findings from dissertation, Predictors of Vocational Calling in Christian College Students: A Structural Model, led to a better understanding of the different ways that men and women interpret and experience a sense of vocational calling. Key findings uncovered intentional avenues that educators in Christian colleges could utilize in helping students understand their unique callings.
